radiographic_examinations.findings: Markedly inflamed appendix demonstrating wall thickening and hyperemia, with extensive neighboring fat stranding, fascial thickening, and an abutting soft tissue density compatible with phlegmon. Focal perforation at the mid aspect of the inflamed appendix, with a small amount of neighboring free fluid. No pericardial or pleural effusion, heart size normal, other abdominal organs normal, no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, and no free air. Mild dependent atelectasis bilaterally at the lung bases.
